Package landclan.com.landparcel.controller

Class LandParcelController

java.lang.Object
landclan.com.landparcel.controller.LandParcelController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api") public class LandParcelController extends Object
Contains a list of all API requests available for CRUD operations on Land Parcels.
Author:
Stefanos Vafiadis

  • Method Details

    • getAllLandParcels

      @GetMapping("/landParcel") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<LandParcelResponse> getAllLandParcels()
      GET /api/landParcel
      Returns:
      Returns all Land Parcels found.
      HTTP CODE HTTP Status Description
      200 OK The request was successful and Land Parcels should be returned in JSON within an Array of name landParcels.
      204 No Content The request was successful but there are no Land Parcels to display currently.
      500 Internal Server Error The request was unsuccessful.

    • getLandParcel

      @GetMapping("/landParcel/{objectId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<LandParcel> getLandParcel(@PathVariable long objectId)
      GET /api/landParcel/{objectId}
      Parameters:
      objectId - The integer value of the ObjectID of the Land Parcel to be found.
      Returns:
      Returns a specific Land Parcel based on the ObjectID provided.
      HTTP CODE HTTP Status Description
      200 OK The request was successful and a land parcel should be return in JSON form.
      204 No Content The request was successful but there are no Land Parcels matching the objectID provided.
      500 Internal Server Error The request was unsuccessful.

    • createLandParcel

      @PostMapping("/landParcel") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity createLandParcel(@RequestBody LandParcel landParcel)
      POST /api/landParcel A land parcel is JSON format must be provided an example shown below { "name": "Test", "status": "SAVED", "area": 15.2, "constraints": false } The field name accepts String values. The field status accepts String values of type {"SAVED", "SHORT_LISTED", "UNDER_CONSIDERATION", "APPROVED"} The field area accepts double values. The field constrains accepts boolean values. All fields must be correctly set otherwise the request will fail, any other fields defined will be ignored (including objectID which is set automatically by the database.
      Parameters:
      landParcel - requires all fields described above to be created.
      Returns:
      The land parcel created in JSON format.
      HTTP CODE HTTP Status Description
      201 Created The request was successful and a land parcel was created.
      400 Bad Request The request was unsuccessful and a Land Parcel was not created.

    • updateLandParcel

      @PutMapping("/landParcel") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity updateLandParcel(@RequestBody LandParcel landParcel)
      PUT /api/landParcel A land parcel is JSON format must be provided, an example shown below { "objectID": 3, "name": "Test", "status": "SAVED", "area": 15.2, "constraints": false } The field objectID accepts biginteger values. The field name accepts String values. The field status accepts String values of type {"SAVED", "SHORT_LISTED", "UNDER_CONSIDERATION", "APPROVED"} The field area accepts double values. The field constrains accepts boolean values. All fields must be correctly set otherwise the request will fail, any other fields defined will be ignored. The objectID field must correspond to an existing land parcel otherwise the request will fail with http code 404.
      Parameters:
      landParcel - requires all fields described above to be updated correctly.
      Returns:
      The land parcel updated in JSON format.
      HTTP CODE HTTP Status Description
      200 OK The request was successful and a land parcel should be return in JSON form.
      400 Bad Request The request was unsuccessful.
      404 Not Found The land parcel with the objectID specified could not be found.

    • deleteLandParcel

      @DeleteMapping("/landParcel/{objectId}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity deleteLandParcel(@PathVariable Long objectId)
      DELETE /api/landParcel/{objectID} To delete a land parcel based on the objectID provided. If an objectID is provided for which a land parcel cannot be found the server will return a 404 http code.
      Parameters:
      objectId - the object ID of the land parcel to be deleted.
      Returns:
      HTTP CODE HTTP Status Description
      200 OK The request was successful and a land parcel should be return in JSON form.
      404 Not Found The land parcel with the objectID specified could not be found.
      500 Internal Server Error The request was unsuccessful.
